problem: Given $\begin{vmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{vmatrix} = 5,$ find $\begin{vmatrix} 2a & 2b \\ 2c & 2d \end{vmatrix}.$
solution:
From $\begin{vmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{vmatrix} = 5,$ $ad - bc = 5.$  Then
\[\begin{vmatrix} 2a & 2b \\ 2c & 2d \end{vmatrix} = (2a)(2d) - (2b)(2c) = 4(ad - bc) = \boxed{20}.\]
socratic_questions:
1. What is the definition of a determinant?
2. Can you explain how the determinant of a 2x2 matrix is calculated?
3. How is the determinant affected when all the elements in a row or a column of the matrix are multiplied by the same constant?
4. If the determinant of a matrix is zero, what does that tell us about the matrix?
5. Given the determinant of a 2x2 matrix, can you find the values of its elements?
6. How does the determinant change when the rows or columns of a matrix are interchanged?
7. Using the properties of determinants, can you explain how to find the determinant of the matrix $\begin{vmatrix} 2a & 2b \\ 2c & 2d \end{vmatrix}$ in terms of the determinant of the matrix $\begin{vmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{vmatrix}$? 
8. Can you use the property mentioned in the previous question to find the determinant of the matrix $\begin{vmatrix} 3 & 4 \\ 6 & 8 \end{vmatrix}$ using the determinant of the matrix $\begin{vmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 3 & 4 \end{vmatrix}$?
